Labeling Folders

Labeling folders is slightly different from labeling items. When you attach a revision label to a folder, you can also attach it to the items that the folder contains and to everything in the subtree for which the folder is the root (its child folders and their contents).

If you detach a revision label from a folder, you can also detach the label from the items associated with the folder and, optionally, from the child folders and their items. If you detach a view label, the label is automatically detached from the items that the folder contains, from the child folders, and from their contents.

Note: To determine whether a label is a revision label or a view label, double-click the label (or select the label, and then click Properties). A revision label has a name and a description. A view label has a name, description, and a configuration time.

To create a new revision label and attach it to a folder and its contents:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Select Labels from the Folder or context menu. The Labels dialog opens.

  3. Select the revision that will receive the new label.

  4. Click New. The Attach a New Revision Label dialog opens.

  5. Enter a name and description for the label in the appropriate text boxes. The maximum label name length is 64 characters and the description length is 254 characters.

  6. (Optional) To ensure that only the selected revision can have this label, select the Frozen (i.e., cannot be changed) check box.

  7. To attach the label to:

    • Only the selected folder, select the Folder only option button.

    • The folder and its items, select the Folder and items contained in folder option button.

    • The folder, its items, and its child folders and their items, select the Everything in subtree rooted at folder option button.

    Note: Because attaching a label to a folder also allows it to be attached to the folder’s contents, children, etc., the label is always attached to the current configuration of each folder and item. You cannot label a prior revision of a folder.

To attach an existing view or revision label to a folder and its contents:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Select Labels from the Folder menu or context menu. The Labels dialog opens.

  3. Click Attach. The Attach a Label dialog lists all the existing labels and identifies them as view or revision labels. By default, both the View labels and Revision labels check boxes are selected.

  4. To display only view labels or revision labels, clear the appropriate check box.

  5. Select a label.

  6. To attach the label to:

    • Only the selected folder, select the Folder only option button.

    • The folder and its items, select the Folder and items contained in folder option button.

    • The folder, its items, its child folders and their items, select the Everything in subtree rooted at folder option button.

    Note: Attaching a label to a folder always attaches it to the current configuration of each folder and item. It is not possible to label a past revision of a folder, although you can do so for items.

  7. Click OK.

To review the labels attached to a folder's revisions:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Select Labels from the Folder or context menu. The Labels dialog opens, listing all labels  currently attached to this folder on a revision-by-revision basis.

To move a revision label from one folder revision to another:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Select Labels from the Folder menu. The Labels dialog opens, showing all labels currently attached to the folder on a revision-by revision basis.

  3. Drag a revision label from one folder revision to another.

For additional information, see Detaching Labels and Selecting Items by Label.
